timeline.bodyText: SubnetSelectorStrategyType could be renamed to filterStrategy as it does not select anymore.

timeline.bodyText: We should add a lot more logging to figure out what happens when it's not something that we expect.
timeline.author: keyki

replies.bodyText: yep already mentioned in the PR description

timeline.bodyText: In my opinion a default implementation might not be the best solution. The algorithm here is the AWS implementation. I would suggest an abstract method with cloud-provider specific implementations.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

replies.bodyText: btw this is the same for mock
replies.author: doktoric

replies.bodyText: I think the default method is fine here becase probably other will use the same except Azure
replies.author: doktoric

timeline.bodyText: I prefer return early over indentations - this is, however, a matter of taste.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

replies.bodyText: If you dont mind I would like to do this way
replies.author: doktoric

timeline.bodyText: This else is far from its corresponding if, I would extract methods for ha and non-ha, respectively.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: The corresponding if is an error handling with return. After that I would omit an else to reduce indentations. This is, however, almost a matter of taste, and so do not insist on it to be changed.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: This algorithm, if given a map with AZs ordered (that is, keys are: AZ-a, AZ-b, AZ-c .. AZ-n) leads to an uneven distribution of selected AZs and so subnets. It might make sense to select AZs randomly as well.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText:
Selection is already done in the NetworkProvider, I would delete the randomization part.
Just a note: if random subnet selection is introduced, then EnvironmentResponse will change from call to call as subnet selection is run every time a GET environment is invoked.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText:
This should be a private method, thus I would extract a class that would contain:

selectSubnets
isDifferentAzCountEnough
groupSubnetsByAz

I would prefer to put this logic to AwsNetworkConnector.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: Private => public (method collects public subnets, log should say public as well).
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: List of private subnets was listed in subnetSelectorService already, I think it is not necessary to log in once again.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: There are now => should read: There are no
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: There are now => should read: There are no
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText:
Consider the case we have 3 subnets:
AZ-a: public (mapPublicIpOnLaunch=true)
AZ-b: private
AZ-c: private
Now, the filter method would return AZ-a only. In this case the select step after the filter will throw an error because fallback private subnets are not present.
A similar problem would be with the PreferPrivate variant.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: Since this is the filter step, I would rather rename it to SubnetFilterStrategy
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: I would rename it to filter.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: The result of filterSubnets is always used in conjunction with select (except for logging). I therefore would not put filterSubnets to the api but would make it a private implementation within AWS / Azure / Mock.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: I think there is enough logging within the selection logic, I would not list the result here again. If logging in the filter - selection is not enough, I would add it there.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: I would omit this logging, for the same reasons as above.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: I would omit logging here. It is present in the filter-select machinery.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: I would log subnets here, should have been logged in the subnet filter-select machinery.
timeline.author: gergopapi2

timeline.bodyText: I would not add these methods to the public api, as for now they are only relevant for AWS only. I would move them to AwsNetworkConnector.
